title.native: ビビッドレッド・オペレーション

description:
Friendship is the key to protecting the world.

That is everyone's wish. Here in a world where science has solved all questions.

This story is set in Oshima. The happy, carefree 14 year old Akane Isshiki lived a poor, but well loved life together with her reliable little sister, Momo, who does all the housework, and her grandfather, Kenjirou, a genius inventor who only created useless devices. When the weather is clear, they can see the artificial island, Blue Island, across the sea. In the center of that island rises the revolutionary Manifestation Engine, a discovery that solved the world's energy problems.

It is a peaceful future, just like everyone dreamed of. One where everyone can smile and be happy...

But suddenly, the world is visited by danger. An unknown enemy, the Alone, appear, targeting the Manifestation Engine. As none of their weapons worked and they fell into despair, a lone girl takes a stand wearing a red "Palette Suit" which wields a great, hidden power. Before long, allies gather around her to fight.

And their friendship becomes the only hope for saving the world!

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

title.native: ビビッドレッド・オペレーション

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

[Website](https://hideyukifukasawa.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eicheph) | [Blog](https://eicheph.blogspot.com/)

Hideyuki Fukasawa is a Japanese composer. He has often worked with [Capcom](https://anilist.co/staff/109955/Capcom) but is also involved in his freelance composing work. He had a minor role in Onimusha 2 as an assistant sound engineer and programmer to [Taro Iwashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/100948/Tarou-Iwashiro), the acclaimed music composer of that particular game but it was his work on Chaos Legion, a Capcom Gothic action-adventure third-person fighting game in a similar fashion with the Devil May Cry series released in 2002, that gave him a cult-like status among video gaming fans. In 2008 he composed and arranged the music for Street Fighter IV, Marvel vs Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds, and the updated versions of both said games, with some tracks arranged from previous games.

He was the main composer for [TYPE-MOON's](https://anilist.co/staff/97582/TypeMoon) remake of the visual novel Tsukihime. 

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Chaos Legion (Video Game, 2003) (Composer)
- Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams (Video Game, 2006) (Composer)
- Street Fighter IV (Video Game, 2008) (Composer)
- Marvel vs. Capcom 3: Fate of Two Worlds (Video Game, 2011) (Composer)
- Street Fighter X Tekken (Video Game, 2012) (Composer)
- Witch on the Holy Night (Visual Novel, 2012) (Composer)
- Street Fighter V (Video Game, 2016) (Composer)
- TSUKIHIME -A piece of blue glass moon- (Visual Novel, 2021) (Composer) !~

[Official Website](https://aya-uchida.net) | [Website](https://columbia.jp/uchidaaya/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ichigoshiroppu/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aya_uchida) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aya_Uchida) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%86%85%E7%94%B0%E5%BD%A9)

She is a Japanese voice actress and singer affiliated with JTB Entertainment. She also a member of famous media franchise "Love Live!".

__Non-anime roles:__
- Quency - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/siglic)

**Shigeru Morita** is a Japanese script/screenwriter.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

[Profile (Stay Luck)](http://stay-luck.com/rie-murakawa) | [Website (Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/murakawarie/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/6riemagic6) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RiEmagic) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rie_Murakawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/村川梨衣)

Japanese voice actress, singer and radio personality, currently affiliated with Stay Luck.

From an early age, she had an interest in playing games as well as magical girl anime such as [Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/Bishoujo-Senshi-Sailor-Moon/) and [Magic Knight Rayearth](https://anilist.co/anime/435/Magic-Knight-Rayearth/). 

During her fifth grade of elementary school, Murakawa started becoming interested in voice acting after watching the anime series [Hunter × Hunter](https://anilist.co/anime/136/Hunter-x-Hunter/).

[Profile](http://earlywing.co.jp/talent_w/otsuboyuka.php) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/00tsubo_yuka) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/43ZsqoTPYf5cc4ae3KPVuU?autoplay=true)

Yuka Ootsubo is a Japanese voice actress and singer affiliated with Early Wing. In 2014, she started her career as a singer by joining the band SmileY inc. with Vocaloid musician Yuuyu-P. She also did the voice of Vocaloid character Azuki Masaoka for V4.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Kaalaa Baunaa - Reverse 1999 (VG)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Website](http://uchidamaaya.jp/) | [Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=26) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/maaya_taso) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/uchidamaayataso/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCJFEXIRB6DP_2FQJzv7pbXg)

Maaya Uchida is a Japanese actress, voice actress and singer who works for I'm Enterprise. She is [Yuuma Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/119617/)'s older sister.

**Awards:**
- She won the Best New Actress Award at the 8th Seiyuu Awards, for her role as [Hajime Ichinose](https://anilist.co/character/85153/).

**Non anime roles:**
